title: Exercise Northstar: After Action
description: The exercise is over. Command wants a data driven after action report analyzing unit readiness, decision speed, and logistics efficiency. Your analysis will shape how the SAF trains for the next 5 years.

software-engineer.title: Build the AAR Dashboard
software-engineer.instruction: The generals want an interactive after action review (AAR) tool that lets them replay the entire exercise with data overlays. They want to scrub through the timeline like a video player and see how decisions played out. How do you build it?

options.label: Build a full timeline replay with the actual map, unit movements, and decision markers. Takes 2 weeks but commanders can literally rewatch the exercise with data annotations.
Generate a static report with key moment snapshots, charts, and automated insights. Done in 3 days and easy to share via PDF. But you lose the interactive element.

Use AI to automatically identify the 20 most critical decision points and generate short analysis clips for each. Novel approach but the AI might miss important moments that don't look dramatic in the data.

Build a collaborative annotation tool where unit commanders can mark up the timeline with their own observations. Richer insights from multiple perspectives but takes time to collect everyone's input.

data-scientist.title: Crunch the Readiness Numbers
data-scientist.instruction: You have mountains of exercise data: GPS tracks, supply requests, communication logs, decision timestamps. The generals want a single readiness score for each unit. Put the analysis steps in order to produce credible results.

items.label: Clean and validate the raw data, removing sensor glitches and duplicate entries
Define the readiness metrics in consultation with exercise planners
Compute individual readiness scores for each unit using the agreed metrics
Cross validate scores against observer reports to catch errors
Visualise the results and present findings to command with confidence intervals

cloud-engineer.title: Calculate Storage Requirements
cloud-engineer.instruction: The exercise generated massive amounts of data that needs to be archived for future training analysis. Based on daily data generation over the last 4 days of the exercise (in terabytes), estimate the total storage (in terabytes) needed for the full 14 day exercise archive including a 30% overhead for metadata and indexes.
